content.raw:
A small bit of this has been addressed in the osx_1.9 branch in [RenderEngine.cc](#!/osrf/gazebo/compare/osx_1.9..issue_775_1.9#Lgazebo/rendering/RenderEngine.ccF347T355).

The bigger issue is in specifying plugins in model or world files (e.g. from [hokuyo model](#!/osrf/gazebo_models/src/c74256fec4eb165bb328d758410c12ab4ecf2aa6/hokuyo/model.sdf#cl-55)):
~~~
<plugin name="laser" filename="libRayPlugin.so" />
~~~
Perhaps we should deprecate the `filename` attribute and make a new one called `base_name` (which would have a value of `RayPlugin` for the hokuyo example).
content.html:
A small bit of this has been addressed in the osx_1.9 branch in RenderEngine.cc.

The bigger issue is in specifying plugins in model or world files (e.g. from hokuyo model):

<plugin name="laser" filename="libRayPlugin.so" />

Perhaps we should deprecate the filename attribute and make a new one called base_name (which would have a value of RayPlugin for the hokuyo example).
